content.question: The figure above shows the graph of the differentiable function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></math> for <math alttext="1 less than or equal to x, less than or equal to 8" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and the secant line through the points <math alttext="with coordinates 1 comma f of 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="coordinates 8 comma f of 8" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>,</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. For how many values of <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> in the closed interval <math alttext="open bracket, 1 comma 8, close bracket" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> does the instantaneous rate of change of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> equal the average rate of change of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> over that interval?

topic.text: 4.1: Interpreting the Meaning of the Derivative in Context

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
